questions.questionText: Which was the first capital of the Mauryan Empire?
questions.explanation: Pataliputra (modern-day Patna) was the capital of the Mauryan Empire

questions.questionText: The Great Bath was found at which Indus Valley site?
questions.explanation: The Great Bath is one of the well-known structures among the ruins of Mohenjo-Daro
Chandragupta Maurya founded the Mauryan Empire around 322 BCE

questions.questionText: The Kalinga War was fought by which Mauryan ruler?
questions.explanation: Ashoka fought the Kalinga War in 261 BCE, which led him to embrace Buddhism
Shah Jahan built the Taj Mahal in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal

questions.questionText: When was the Indian National Congress founded?
questions.explanation: The Indian National Congress was founded in 1885 by A.O. Hume

questions.questionText: The First Battle of Panipat was fought in which year?
questions.explanation: The First Battle of Panipat was fought in 1526 between Babur and Ibrahim Lodi

questions.questionText: Who was the author of Arthashastra?
questions.explanation: Arthashastra was written by Kautilya (also known as Chanakya)

questions.questionText: The Quit India Movement was launched in which year?
questions.explanation: The Quit India Movement was launched on 8 August 1942 by Mahatma Gandhi

questions.questionText: Which Mughal emperor introduced the Din-i-Ilahi religion?
questions.explanation: Akbar introduced Din-i-Ilahi, a syncretic religion combining elements of various faiths

questions.questionText: The Jallianwala Bagh massacre occurred in which year?
questions.explanation: The Jallianwala Bagh massacre took place on 13 April 1919 in Amritsar

questions.questionText: Who was the first Sultan of Delhi?
questions.explanation: Qutub-ud-din Aibak was the first Sultan of Delhi (1206-1210)

questions.questionText: Lothal, a site of Indus Valley Civilization, is located in which state?
questions.explanation: Lothal is located in Gujarat and was an important port city of Indus Valley Civilization

questions.questionText: How many Mahajanapadas existed in the later Vedic period?
questions.explanation: There were 16 Mahajanapadas (great kingdoms) in ancient India during the later Vedic period

questions.questionText: The partition of Bengal was done in which year?
questions.explanation: The partition of Bengal was carried out by Lord Curzon in 1905
